description: Latin adaequātus, past participle of adaequō (“to make equal to”); ad + aequō (“to make equal”), from aequus (“equal”).

adjectives.description: adequate (comparative more adequate, superlative most adequate)

entries.meaning: Equal to or fulfilling some requirement.
examples: Synonyms: acceptable, correspondent, proportionate, satisfactory, sufficient
powers adequate to a great work

verbs.description: adequate (third-person singular simple present adequates, present participle adequating, simple past and past participle adequated)

examples: Let me giue yet one instance more, of a truly intellectuall obiect, exactly adequated and proportioned vnto the intellectuall appetite.
[…]  though it be an impossibilitie for any creature to adequate God in his eternitie, yet he hath ordained all his sonnes in Christ to partake of it by living with him eternally.
